Sentencas: Buckling damage and spallation during oxidation are prime challenges in electroplated Cu -Mn oxide spinel coatings prepared for SOFC interconnects.
Titulo: Formation mechanism and oxidation behavior of Cu-Mn spinel coating on ferritic stainless steel for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: (Cu,Mn)3O4 spinel coating is formed on AISI-430 stainless steel by oxidizing electroplated copper and manganese layers at 750 degrees C in air.
Titulo: Formation mechanism and oxidation behavior of Cu-Mn spinel coating on ferritic stainless steel for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: Nickel strike deposition significantly reduces coating spallation.
Titulo: Formation mechanism and oxidation behavior of Cu-Mn spinel coating on ferritic stainless steel for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: During oxidation at 750 degrees C, spinel coating hinders chromium migration and improves the oxidation behavior of the alloy by a decrease of 98.9% in the parabolic oxidation rate constant.
Titulo: Formation mechanism and oxidation behavior of Cu-Mn spinel coating on ferritic stainless steel for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: Formation mechanism of the spinel is investigated, revealing that manganese initially forms MnO, Mn2O3, and Mn3O4.
Titulo: Formation mechanism and oxidation behavior of Cu-Mn spinel coating on ferritic stainless steel for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: Over the time, copper oxidizes to CuO, and Mn2O3 replaces MnO and Mn3O4.
Titulo: Formation mechanism and oxidation behavior of Cu-Mn spinel coating on ferritic stainless steel for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: Finally, (Cu,Mn)3O4 spinel forms after 6 h of oxidation by the co-existence of CuO and Mn2O3.
Titulo: Formation mechanism and oxidation behavior of Cu-Mn spinel coating on ferritic stainless steel for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: It is concluded that manganese oxidation induces buckling damage due to a volume increase of up to 137% in the coating during the earliest stages of the oxidation.
Titulo: Formation mechanism and oxidation behavior of Cu-Mn spinel coating on ferritic stainless steel for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects
